title-group.article-title: Products and Sums of Powers of Binomial Coefficients $\operatorname{mod} p$ and Solutions of Certain Quaternary Diophantine Systems

abstract.p: In this paper we prove that certain products and sums of powers of binomial coefficients modulo $p = qf + 1, q = a^2 + b^2$, are determined by the parameters $x$ occurring in distinct solutions of the quaternary quadratic partition $$16p^\alpha = x^2 + 2qu^2 + 2qv^2 + qw^2, \quad (x, u, v, w, p) = 1, \\ xw = av^2 - 2buv - au^2, \quad x \equiv 4 (\operatorname{mod} q), \alpha \geqslant 1.$$ The number of distinct solutions of this partition depends heavily on the class number of the imaginary cyclic quartic field $$K = Q(i\sqrt{2q + 2a\sqrt q}),$$ as well as on the number of roots of unity in $K$ and on the way that $p$ splits into prime ideals in the ring of integers of the field $Q(e^{2\pi ip/q})$. Let the four cosets of the subgroup $A$ of quartic residues be given by $c_j = 2^jA, j = 0, 1, 2, 3$, and let $$s_j = \frac{1}{q} \sum_{t \in c_j} t, \quad j = 0, 1, 2, 3.$$ Let $s_m$ and $s_n$ denote the smallest and next smallest of the $s_j$ respectively. We give new, and unexpectedly simple determinations of $\Pi_{k \in c_n} kf!$ and $\Pi_{k \in c_{n + 2}} kf!$, in terms of the parameters $x$ in the above partition of $16p^\alpha$, in the complicated case that arises when the class number of $K$ is $> 1$ and $s_m \neq s_n$.
